title: Air Canada to resume flights after pay deal struck with union
byline: Flight crew at Air Canada have ended a dispute with the airline which had grounded flights and stranded thousands of passengers since Saturday.

title: Court orders report on unauthorised excavation in Anuradhapura involving wife of DIG
byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court has ordered that an urgent report be submitted regarding alleged unauthorised excavations carried out in the Timbirigaskadawala area of Sravastipura, Anuradhapura, allegedly in search of treasure.

title: “Suwa Seriya” ambulances to be increased from 272 to 400
byline: A review of the projects implemented under the 2025 budgetary allocations for the Ministry of Health and Mass Media, together with a pre-budget discussion for the year 2026, was held yesterday (19) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the country today
byline: A few showers can be expected in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Kandy, Nuwara Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Sri Lanka Aviation Unit honoured for outstanding service in MINUSCA
byline: The Sri Lanka Aviation Unit in Bria, serving under the United Nations mandate in the Central African Republic, has received high praise and official commendation for the successful execution of a high-risk Casualty Evacuation mission.

title: India, China agree to resume direct flights, boost business links
byline: India and China agreed on Tuesday to resume direct flights and step up trade and investment flows as the neighbours rebuild ties damaged by a deadly border clash in 2020.

title: Over 1,300 driving licenses issued to foreign nationals at BIA
byline: A total of 1,338 driving licenses have been issued to foreign nationals by the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) office established at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake since its opening.

title: Health Ministry temporarily suspends staff leave, Union claims decision unlawful
byline: The Ministry of Health states that due to a high volume of staff members taking leave of absence, it has become increasingly difficult to sustain the continuous operation of essential services within the ministry.

title: White House launches official TikTok account
byline: The White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday, taking advantage of its more than 150 million U.S. users to spread the messages of President Donald Trump.

title: Postal workers continue strike action across the country
byline: The Postal and Telecommunication Officers’ Union has announced that the trade union action initiated by postal workers on Sunday, will continue today as well, affecting postal operations across the country.

title: Ex-Minister Manusha Nanayakkara arrives at Illegal Assets Investigation Division
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has arrived at the Illegal Assets Investigation Division of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), a short while ago, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Man Killed with blunt weapon in Peliyagoda
byline: An individual has been killed with the use of a blunt weapon in Wedamulla, Peliyagoda, police said.

title: Israel demands release of all Gaza hostages, casting doubt on ceasefire proposal
byline: Israel is demanding the release of all 50 hostages held in Gaza, an Israeli official has said, casting doubt on whether it will accept a new proposal for a 60-day ceasefire that Hamas agreed to on Monday.
